articles.author: Paul67
articles.description: We were four games into last season before we kept a clean sheet, and that was a dreadful 0-0 at home to St Johnstone, who rued a gilt-edged chance to leave with the win.  Ross County, Aberdeen and Kilmarnock all scored against Celtic in their earlier games There was never any chance of Kasper Schmeichel [...]

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: REO HATATE lashed in Celtic’s first goal of the 2024/25 campaign as the champions thundered to a 4-0 triumph over Kilmarnock at Parkhead on Flag Day. The Japanese international midfielder, beset by injury problems last season, deservedly won the Man of the Match accolade and earned praise from delighted boss Brendan Rodgers afterwards, as CQN [...]
articles.title: WATCH AGAIN: HATA’S THE WAY TO DO IT, BHOYS

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: KYOGO FURUHASHI fired blanks in Celtic’s opening day 4-0 triumph over Kilmarnock at Parkhead. However, the pacy Japanese striker was in the thick of the action throughout as he made life a misery for the opponents’ central defenders Stuart Findlay and Simon Mayo. Kyogo saw one effort hooked off the line by Brad Lyons in [...]

articles.description: EXACTLY A YEAR ago, Reo Hatate was on the substitutes’ bench when Brendan Rodgers kicked off his second coming as Celtic manager. The champions were due to play Ross County in the Premiership opener at Parkhead and David Turnbull was given the nod ahead of the Japanese ace. The Scotland international midfielder repaid the returning gaffer’s [...]

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: MYSTERY has surrounded the non-appearance of Celtic great John ‘Yogi’ Hughes from Jock Stein’s Lisbon line-up ever since that memorable, history-making day in the Portuguese capital on May 25 1967. The iconic Hoops star played in five of the eight games leading up to the European Cup Final, but the nearest he got to the action [...]

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: THE third season of Tommy Burns’ turbulent time in charge of Celtic ended abruptly when he was fired. The Scottish Cup semi-final replay exit against First Division Falkirk on April 23 1997 brought down the curtain on the fans’ favourite dug-out involvement just before the completion of an explosive, topsy-turvy 1996/97 campaign. Burns had returned [...]
articles.title: THE TOMMY BURNS STORY: ‘SURE AS GOD, I’VE NOT DONE ANYTHING TO MAKE ME WANT TO WALK OUT THE BACK DOOR’: Part Twenty-five

However, Hinkel was often asked to play back-up to [...]
articles.title: WHATEVER HAPPENED TO…ANDREAS HINKEL?
